"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ffdfa6636872305e2d0300#post_54ffdfa6636872305e2d0300
[bq="uc9"]"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ffdf2c6368726764b81600#post_54ffdf2c6368726764b81600
[bq="Gizoid101"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ffded16368726764761600#post_54ffded16368726764761600
Whats the diference of today and a decade ago?[/bq]
Widespread adoption of the internet to the point that we can no longer function as a society without it causing massive amounts of covert societal drift.[/bq]
It's hard to believe that just over a decade ago, not everyone had the internet at home. Most people still watched analogue cable TV or playing outside. The internet feels like it's been here forever.

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ffe2436368727f9c870f00#post_54ffe2436368727f9c870f00
DMC4 pulled almost 2 million units in it's FIRST WEEK. Throughout it's life DMC4 has sold over THREE MILLION UNITS. And that's not even counting digital distribution sales.
DmC on the other barely pulled two million units in it's ENTIRE FISCAL YEAR.

Its fucking hilarious!

topics.body: One of the biggest criticisms fir DMC4 was the whole "Revisiting levels" thing. Which I honestly didn't mind that much. I mean you were playing as an entirely different character with a radically different playstyle. So it at least kept it interesting. And I understand why they did it from a technical level too. The environments and textures in DMC4 were fucking GORGEOUS. Even today they hold up super well. So they made a few beautiful environments as opposed to a lot of mediocre ones so they had to reuse some stuff.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

Like Nero was supposed to have more play styles and Dante was supposed to Enter into Hell.
